meanings.definition: Excessive adherence to prescribed methods or forms.
meanings.sent1: Her formulism in following the rules made her stand out in the class.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's formulism in grading papers was known to all the students.
meanings.sent3: John's formulism in organizing his desk was so extreme that he color-coded every item.
meanings.sent4: The company's formulism in handling customer complaints led to a lack of flexibility.
meanings.sent5: The formulism of the recipe made it impossible for any variation in the final dish.

meanings.sent2: The mathematician explained the formulism behind the complex theorem.
meanings.sent3: The formulism of the equation looked like a secret code to the students.
meanings.sent4: The formulism of the mathematical model allowed for accurate predictions.
